articles.title: Trump taps Jeanine Pirro for top DC prosecutor job

neutral.body:
President Trump announced his decision on Thursday to appoint Jeanine Pirro, a Fox News host and former judge, as the interim top prosecutor in the District of Columbia. The President made the announcement on social media, praising Pirro's legal background and experience.
Pirro's appointment comes with a mix of reactions from various circles. Supporters of the President view Pirro as a strong and experienced candidate who will bring a fresh perspective to the role. They highlight her background as a judge and her legal expertise as valuable assets for the position.
Critics, on the other hand, express concerns about Pirro's close ties to the President and her outspoken views on various political issues. They question her ability to remain impartial and independent in a role that requires unbiased judgment.
As Pirro steps into this interim position, she faces the challenge of proving her capabilities and winning over skeptics. The responsibility of serving as the top prosecutor in the District of Columbia is a significant one, and Pirro's performance in the role will be closely watched and evaluated by both supporters and critics alike.

articles.title: Father of 15-year-old who killed 2 at Wisconsin religious school faces felony charges

neutral.headline: Father of School Shooter Charged in Wisconsin
neutral.body:
Wisconsin prosecutors announced on Thursday that they have charged the father of a teenage girl involved in a school shooting with allowing her access to the semiautomatic pistols used in the attack. The tragic incident, which occurred last year, resulted in the death of a teacher and a fellow student.
The decision to charge the father comes after a thorough investigation into the circumstances surrounding the shooting. Authorities have alleged that the father's actions contributed to his daughter's ability to obtain the firearms used in the attack.
The charges highlight the importance of responsible gun ownership and the need for parents to secure their firearms to prevent unauthorized access, especially by minors. This case serves as a somber reminder of the devastating consequences that can arise when firearms end up in the wrong hands.
As the legal process unfolds, it will be crucial to examine the evidence and testimonies to determine the extent of the father's liability in this tragic event. The goal is to seek justice for the victims and their families while also promoting greater awareness of firearm safety measures in our communities.

articles.title: SALT caucus rejects tax-writing panel’s offer of $30,000 deduction cap

neutral.headline: Moderate House Republicans Express Concerns Over SALT Deduction Proposal
neutral.body:
A group of moderate House Republicans has raised concerns about a proposed increase in the state and local tax (SALT) deduction cap to $30,000 within the GOP leadership's bill aligned with President Trump's legislative agenda. The House Ways and Means Committee has been exploring various options to address the issue of SALT deductions, which have been a topic of debate among lawmakers.
The moderates argue that the proposed increase may not adequately address the concerns of taxpayers in high-tax states, who have been disproportionately affected by the current deduction cap. They emphasize the importance of finding a balanced solution that provides relief to all taxpayers while also promoting fiscal responsibility.
While discussions are ongoing within the party, the concerns raised by moderate Republicans highlight the complexity of addressing tax policy in a way that benefits all Americans. Finding common ground on this issue will require careful consideration and collaboration among lawmakers from different ideological backgrounds. It remains to be seen how these concerns will ultimately impact the final legislation and whether a compromise can be reached to address the concerns of all stakeholders involved.
